Authors: Carissa A., Natalia J., Lasini M., Gunadi W.
Title: Understanding the role of sensory, emotional, social and memorable experiences in behavioural intention of Indonesia’s music concert industry
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Management Department BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Carissa, A., Management Department BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Natalia, J., Management Department BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lasini, M., Management Department BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gunadi, W., Management Department BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Experiential marketing has been recognized as one of the most effective ways to magnetize concert attendees. This phenomenon has widely opened opportunity for promoters to market and to display in their events, precisely in Indonesia young populations nowadays. This research is conducted to provide novelty in music concert industry, to capture insightful experiential perspective, and to identify the role of sensory, emotional, social and memorable experiences in behavioural intention of Indonesia’s music concert industry. Data is collected through online questionnaires and analyzed by using PLS-SEM. The results indicate that memorable experience is the most influential factor to behavioural intention, social experience is the second, sensory is the third, and the least prioritized is emotional experience. Lastly, there are soluble implications explained which fully support the results of this research. © IJSTR 2020.
Author Keywords: Behavioural Intention; Emotional; Experiential Marketing; Memorable; Sensory; Social
